segment.source: Swap chains in DirectX 11.2
segment.target: Swap chains in DirectX 11.2

segment.source: Direct3D 11.2 allows you to create Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps with swap chains that are scaled up from non-native (reduced) resolutions, enabling faster fill rates.
segment.target: Direct3D 11.2 allows you to create Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps with swap chains that are scaled up from non-native (reduced) resolutions, enabling faster fill rates.

segment.source: Direct3D 11.2 also includes APIs for rendering with hardware overlays so that you can present a UI in another swap chain at native resolution.
segment.target: Direct3D 11.2 also includes APIs for rendering with hardware overlays so that you can present a UI in another swap chain at native resolution.

segment.source: This allows your game to draw UI at full native resolution while maintaining a high framerate, thereby making the best use of mobile devices and high DPI displays (such as 3840 by 2160).
segment.target: This allows your game to draw UI at full native resolution while maintaining a high framerate, thereby making the best use of mobile devices and high DPI displays (such as 3840 by 2160).

segment.source: When your game is running on downlevel hardware - or hardware optimized for power savings - it can be beneficial to render real-time game content at a lower resolution than the display is natively capable of.
segment.target: When your game is running on downlevel hardware - or hardware optimized for power savings - it can be beneficial to render real-time game content at a lower resolution than the display is natively capable of.

segment.source: To do this, the swap chain that is used for rendering game content must be smaller than the native resolution, or a subregion of the swapchain must be used.
segment.target: To do this, the swap chain that is used for rendering game content must be smaller than the native resolution, or a subregion of the swapchain must be used.

segment.source: First, create a swap chain at full native resolution.
segment.target: First, create a swap chain at full native resolution.

segment.source: Then, choose a subregion of the swap chain to scale up by setting the source size to a reduced resolution.
segment.target: Then, choose a subregion of the swap chain to scale up by setting the source size to a reduced resolution.

segment.source: When using swap chain scaling, there is an inherent disadvantage in that the UI is also scaled down, potentially making it blurry and harder to use.
segment.target: When using swap chain scaling, there is an inherent disadvantage in that the UI is also scaled down, potentially making it blurry and harder to use.

segment.source: On devices with hardware support for overlay swap chains, this problem is alleviated entirely by rendering the UI at native resolution in a swap chain that's separate from the real-time game content.
segment.target: On devices with hardware support for overlay swap chains, this problem is alleviated entirely by rendering the UI at native resolution in a swap chain that's separate from the real-time game content.

segment.source: Note that this technique applies only to CoreWindow swap chains - it cannot be used with XAML interop.

segment.source: Create the foreground swap chain with IDXGIFactory2::CreateSwapChainForCoreWindow.
segment.target: Create the foreground swap chain with IDXGIFactory2::CreateSwapChainForCoreWindow.

segment.source: The following options must be set in the DXGI\_SWAP\_CHAIN\_DESC1 supplied to the pDesc parameter:
segment.target: The following options must be set in the DXGI\_SWAP\_CHAIN\_DESC1 supplied to the pDesc parameter:

segment.source: Specify the DXGI\_SWAP\_CHAIN\_FLAG\_FOREGROUND\_LAYER swap chain flag to indicate a foreground swap chain.
segment.target: Specify the DXGI\_SWAP\_CHAIN\_FLAG\_FOREGROUND\_LAYER swap chain flag to indicate a foreground swap chain.

segment.source: Use the DXGI\_ALPHA\_MODE\_PREMULTIPLIED alpha mode flag.
segment.target: Use the DXGI\_ALPHA\_MODE\_PREMULTIPLIED alpha mode flag.

segment.source: Foreground swap chains are always premultiplied.
segment.target: Foreground swap chains are always premultiplied.

segment.source: Set the DXGI\_SCALING\_NONE flag.
segment.target: Set the DXGI\_SCALING\_NONE flag.

segment.source: Foreground swap chains always run at native resolution.
segment.target: Foreground swap chains always run at native resolution.

segment.source: Note Set the DXGI\_SWAP\_CHAIN\_FLAG\_FOREGROUND\_LAYER again every time the swap chain is resized.
segment.target: Note Set the DXGI\_SWAP\_CHAIN\_FLAG\_FOREGROUND\_LAYER again every time the swap chain is resized.

segment.source: When two swap chains are being used, increase the maximum frame latency to 2 so that the DXGI adapter has time to present both swap chains simultaneously (within the same VSync interval).
segment.target: When two swap chains are being used, increase the maximum frame latency to 2 so that the DXGI adapter has time to present both swap chains simultaneously (within the same VSync interval).

segment.source: Foreground swap chains always use premultiplied alpha.
segment.target: Foreground swap chains always use premultiplied alpha.

segment.source: Each pixel's color values are expected to be already multiplied by the alpha value before the frame is presented.
segment.target: Each pixel's color values are expected to be already multiplied by the alpha value before the frame is presented.

segment.source: For example, a 100% white BGRA pixel at 50% alpha is set to (0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5).
segment.target: For example, a 100% white BGRA pixel at 50% alpha is set to (0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5).

segment.source: The alpha premultiplication step can be done in the output-merger stage by applying an app blend state (see ID3D11BlendState) with the D3D11\_RENDER\_TARGET\_BLEND\_DESC structure's SrcBlend field set to D3D11\_SRC\_ALPHA.
segment.target: The alpha premultiplication step can be done in the output-merger stage by applying an app blend state (see ID3D11BlendState) with the D3D11\_RENDER\_TARGET\_BLEND\_DESC structure's SrcBlend field set to D3D11\_SRC\_ALPHA.

segment.source: Assets with pre-multiplied alpha values can also be used.
segment.target: Assets with pre-multiplied alpha values can also be used.

segment.source: If the alpha premultiplication step is not done, colors on the foreground swap chain will be brighter than expected.
segment.target: If the alpha premultiplication step is not done, colors on the foreground swap chain will be brighter than expected.
